website_summaries.verdict: The D80 might not have WiFi capability or talk with Alexa, but it gets the job done, regardless.
pros: LaserSmart mapping scans and maps room
Combo brush and spiral blade brush
Returns to charging station if needed to complete job
Runs up to 60 minutes after a full charge
Detects objects well and works around them
cons: Since it is designed to roll over high shag rugs and other obstacles, it occasionally tries to roll up table legs and baseboards

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want something that lasts a few months
customer_reviews.text: We've had the D3 for less than a year and now need to replace the batteries. Even though the unit is still under warranty. Customer service is horrible and frankly useless (tells us to watch a YouTube video of how to reset... After we've told them we've reset it 5 times already... I can Google thanks!). Super disappointed... also ruined the legs of our table when it would get stuck. It scratched the heck out of it, to the point the espresso-color legs show the real wood color beneath. Garbage. Save yourself the hassle and buy a Roomba
customer_reviews.author: maroca

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this brand!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sad to say I was very disappointed that I’m having to replace this vacuum after one year. Lots of charging hassles. Lots of trying to find solutions. I loved it when it worked. Consumer reports recommends “Black and Decker $199””,Roomba 618 $328.88 “ and “Shark ion -$280”. All also sold on Amazon. Consumer reports has ALWAYS BEEN ACCURATE MY ENTIRE LIFE. Robot vacs are definitely awesome! If the manufacturer makes amends to this situation, I will write another review.
customer_reviews.author: Happysillygirl

customer_reviews.title: Works at first, then conpletely stops workinv.
customer_reviews.text: In 4 short months, my product has entirely stopped finding the charging base on its own, even when it is started from it, it can barely complete a full cycle of the house without getting stuck and needing to start entirely over, and it reports errors that don't make sense. I don't understand how this product has such good reviews online, as for me it turned out to be a massive waste of cash. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Light use of this robot but still it has stayed ...
customer_reviews.text: Light use of this robot but still it has stayed down for the last 2 months. Used 1 time/week at first , the 2 times/ month. I finally looked up the warranty. I should have noticed sooner. 3 MONTHS. WARRANTY , THAT'S WHAT THEY THINK OF THEIR PRODUCT.. I paid a lot to learn the lesson, if they can't back their own product,,,,there is a reason...it's not worth backing. LATER, LATER. Finally sent this rot in for repairs. For 3 months VERY LIGHT use: $190 repair estimate. $500 cost + $200 repairs for less than 3 months use. A little less than $700 ! You decide if this is a good deal or a "forget that" deal.
customer_reviews.author: Patron

customer_reviews.title: We have a love / hate relationship.
customer_reviews.text: I loved my first Neato until it died at the 1 year mark. I bought this one, and sadly the unit is nonfunctional after 10 months. Support says the battery is dead and is only covered by a 6 month warranty (the rest is 1 year). I'm waiting to hear if they'll send me a new one after escalating my request. If so- great! I'll continue to be a Neato Robotics customer as I love it when it works. At this point, I have serious concerns about their longevity. I don't want to replace an expensive vacuum every 10-12 months.
customer_reviews.author: E. Simone

customer_reviews.title: Always needs repairs
customer_reviews.text: This is my second purchase of a Neato and my last. Quit working within 10 months. I thought it was the battery and replaced it. It does nothing!! $900 wasted over 4 years. I loved the method of cleaning in Pattern which covers the area very well but, both quit working before they were a year old. Had many trouble shooting calls for the first and even had it replaced but nothing fixed it for more than a few months. Thought there would have been improvements by now but I was wrong. Don’t waste good money on a bad product
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Neato not so Neat - One day and it's not working!
customer_reviews.text: Just got this D80 yesterday. Charged overnight as instructed. It cleaned one time, until the battery needed recharging, made its way back to the charger. Wouldn't charge! Called Neato - same "canned" response - We're sorry for this, looks like your charger isn't working! Thank you, Captain Obvious! Then we're told, the quickest way to get a replacement is to contact Amazon! Way to stand behind your product, Neato! Of course Amazon has excellent customer service and they are replacing it. Not impressed so far! I'll update this review when I get my replacement if it lasts more than 24 hrs!
customer_reviews.author: Moreygirl

customer_reviews.title: Get a roomba.
customer_reviews.text: 2 years later and this thing is a piece of crap. I wish I hadn’t wasted my money and just bought the roomba. This thing gets stuck every where. It can’t handle an entire room. It has issues going from tile to carpet. The hair gets stuck in its brush and then just falls out as it’s going in giant chunks. The worst though are the CONSTANT problems. I bought 2 other vacuums because this one was ALWAYS down and I don’t always have hours to sit and troubleshoot this stupid machine. Also I’m an electronics technician for the US Navy. So I know a thing about troubleshooting and this thing is crap. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the first one that I bought which stopped working after 2 years, Amazon replaced it because of a mistake on their part. This one quit working after 1-1/2 years. I did buy a warranty, so I can get this one repaired. I will NEVER buy a Neato product again. This vacuum is not used that much and I do not have pets, the machine is not made to last. Customer service is so slow, I have done everything they instructed me to...again and again. I have been dealing with them for over a month. I would not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for controlling cat hair and litter crystals
customer_reviews.text: We have two of these vacuum cleaners–one for our 1600 square foot downstairs and another for our 500 square foot upstairs. We have two cats and must constantly vacuum to control both cat hair and litter crystals. These two vacuum cleaners do a fine job in controlling both cat hair and litter crystals. Unlike a vacuums run by a human, they get into tight corners and under furniture. Unlike human-operated vacuums, they don't t get bored with their cleaning tasks after five minutes. The carpets, thresholds, and multiple rooms of our house don't flummox these vacuum cleaners. The upstairs vacuum cleaner has not thrown itself down our stairs. They're not too noisy and don't frighten our cats.
customer_reviews.author: John F. Miller

customer_reviews.title: No real longevity in an expensive home appliance
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works well. I've had my Neato for a couple of years now and had it vacuuming 3x a week. I've had to replace the battery multiple times and have an ongoing issue with the sensor that requires me to get it going with a q-tip every time the vacuum starts up. The service has been mediocre at best and overall I just don't feel like this device performed at a level that is consistent with its price tag. I definitely will not be purchasing another Neato to replace this one based on the many other reviews that have been negative.
customer_reviews.author: dgincarson

customer_reviews.title: I'm sorry but for the price of these units I would not recommend to anyone based on the battery issues
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these in December 2017 and the battery has died on both already. $41 for new battery and you have to replace every 7 months or so. Neato has a 1 year warranty but only 6 months on the battery. I'm sorry but for the price of these units I would not recommend to anyone based on the battery issues.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey M Neltner

customer_reviews.title: bad customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased one in August 2017 for our office, loved it, it worked great, so we bought another one for our home. The one I purchased in August broke, it says please put me down, even when it is down. I contacted customer service on June 12...waited and waited for a reply, finally got one, they are saying it is past the one-year warranty and they won't fix it???? ONE YEAR...how can it be one year when I've only had it for 10 months before it broke For the price of this...I expect way better.
customer_reviews.author: Perdie

customer_reviews.title: I started getting the bumper stuck error and upon googling I found it's a very common problem due to poor quality springs
customer_reviews.text: First thing first, phenomenal while it works. Problem is, it worked barely a few months for me. I started getting the bumper stuck error and upon googling I found it's a very common problem due to poor quality springs. Oh did I mention Neato's customer service is GARBAGE!! Once they come up with a model that is sturdy, this will be a no-brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Chetan Gohil

customer_reviews.title: The most expensive piece of junk I own
customer_reviews.text: You dont know junk until you own this Botvac. I was under the assumption that based on price, this was a quality product. I assumed wrong. Battery needs replacement every 6 months. When it's dead its dead, the battery is extremely finnicky. I stopped using my vacuum, just manually do it. Dont have the heart to throw away a $500 vacuum. Just a complete waste of money, thank goodness I never suggested anyone to buy this, would be egg all over my face.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: I wanted to like this due to the design features of a systematic ...
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like this due to the design features of a systematic cleaning pattern and ability to clean corners. However when activated it pulls away from the base, starts the brushes and vacuum a few times but never moves any farther away from the base. Ultimately just quits and beeps at you without ever miving more than six inches. Customer service from France wasn't able to walk me through a solution and seemed predisposed to exchanging the unit from past experience of not getting their products to function.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: No support
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for eight months and then stopped working. Got very little customer support. Unit display didn't work and in the emails they were telling me to push buttons on the display. When I continued my emails they stopped responding. Buy the extended warranty or buy a competitors product.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Coffey

customer_reviews.title: Works great - for 10 months...
customer_reviews.text: I loved Neato for the 10 months it worked. The amount of dirt it collected everyday was surprising. We have a large multi room downstairs with hardwood and tiles throughout. Neato handles our low ply area rugs perfectly, and only gets stuck on one door rug every now and then. I get an error code that won't go away. I'll attempt to return it and update my review accordingly. It's definitely not worth the price if it only works for 10 months.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Would NOT recommend
customer_reviews.text: This vaccum was definitely not worth the money!! We had it about 3 weeks and returned it. It didn't vaccum well. I used the strips to pin it in the kitchen but it still would let clean the whole space. Also, we had it cleaning about 1000sq ft and it would run out of battery power before cleaning it all.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: Had this 2 months and it already stopped working. Says clean brush, I did. Now it just goes for 2 seconds and turns off. Return window was only one month. Save yourself the headache and buy a Roomba. Half the price isn't worth it if it only lasts two months.
customer_reviews.author: Jez Helva

customer_reviews.title: Do not ever purchase from Neato Robotics!  Worst customer service ever.
customer_reviews.text: Do not ever purchase from Neato Robotics! Robot works wonderfully for several month and that it stops recognizing its battery. Replacing battery does not solve the issue. Customer Service is a complete nightmare. I contacted them 2 month ago and they still refuse to replace their broken/faulty product. I requested to be contacted by supervisor or to be provided with supervisor contact information and this rep "Cillian" is just keeps mocking me. I truly can not believe that for $500 defective machine that is less than 6 month old I can not get a replacement. If anyone from the company monitoring this, my ticket # is 435762.
customer_reviews.author: Irina J.

customer_reviews.title: Great for those with allergies
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this based on months of research and debate between the Neato and the Roomba. I like the fact this vacuum runs around the perimeter of the room, then goes back and forth across the floor in a pattern to maintain efficiency. There have been a couple of times where it gets lost if you open and close doors on it. We purchased this because of my allergies and I am amazed with the amount of dog and cat hair it picks up every day. Controls on the unit are easy enough to use, and scheduling is a breeze. No need to get the one with the smart phone app.
customer_reviews.author: Tom C

customer_reviews.title: A bunch of money for no-one to warranty these.
customer_reviews.text: These are probably the least problematic of the Neato vacs, but there are no parts other than brushes and filters to support them. The seller doesn’t stand behind the warranty. They rely on the manufacturer to do that. I have been waiting 2 mos for parts that may or may not fix my bot. No one will replace these when they fail within warranty. And the seller wont exchange it either.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Don’t.
customer_reviews.text: Seriously don’t. I’m sitting here listening to my neato run into the wall over, and over, and over again then stop, sounding its alarm and asking me to clear its path (of a wall). Today it has cleaned the office three times has not gone into the bathroom or bedroom is still trying to run into the wall after I hit the button asking it to return to base. Just don’t. Also it was about $80 more expensive when I bought it. It did work better when we first got it, but it has gotten more bizarre in its behavior over the last several months (we have had it about 10 months).
customer_reviews.author: J.B.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. This bot has several shortcomings
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. This bot has several shortcomings. 1. Every cleaning cycle it gets stuck at least once under some furniture. 2. Fencing for containing the robot requires a visible strip across the boundary - it’s brown and unsightly. 3. It has yet to be able to find and return to its base after a while house cleaning. Bottom line: avoid this device if you want to have handsfree cleaning of your floors. It is ineffective and I’d return it if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is super efficient. It's mapping pattern is impressive. If the battery holds up and it can handle a daily run for a year, it'll be worth every penny. It's set to cover 4 rooms and runs for an hour and 20 minutes straight. Dust bin must be emptied daily (Cat and Great Pyr). Can't believe how much it picks up every day from these beasts. Surprisingly, they are fascinated by the robot. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: poor product and inconsistent customer service.
customer_reviews.text: customer service sucks. No one can figure out what is wrong and I’ve talked to 4 people about it. This is my 5th Neato and after 3mos use it is having problems, I’m done with this brand. They are junk and customer service and extended warranty does you no good after they make you jump through hoops and still can’t figure out the problem. I’m so done with them.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Yokley

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this thinking it would be a way to save time and keep the floors clean. Between having to save it from being stuck and cleaning out the inside and the roller it ended up taking more time than if I had just vacuumed myself. Finally it recently started malfunctioning where it doesn't work at all. Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Wont even last 3 years
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this vacuum for about 3 years now and It was working pretty well. I havent used it in about 6 months so i threw it on the charger and it will just sit there and tell me to turn the switch to the on position (its on). It refuses to charge and just beeps . I had my roomba for twice as long and no issues at all. very un happy I cant get my $550 dollar vacuum to even charge.
customer_reviews.author: andrew fish

customer_reviews.title: VERY UNSATISFIED!
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to the description, it can't clean a house with furniture or area rugs. I constantly had to "clear [its] path" or fiddle with its wheels. VERY UNSATISFIED! It's worthless to me since I have to babysit it, and even then, it didn't work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: e

customer_reviews.title: I like the ease to empty the dust cup but I ...
customer_reviews.text: More powerful than the Roomba 650 and definitely goes over the black in the carpet, which Roomba didn't. It's able to lift itself up to get out of a predicament, but it gets stuck a lot because it doesn't know how tall it is. I like the ease to empty the dust cup but I don't like that I can't take the filter out and clean it. Not the greatest in corners but all right. Must be supervised! Cat loves it. I'm keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: jdwwhawaii

customer_reviews.title: Missing pieces
customer_reviews.text: Came with pieces missing and due to it being a gift for someone, missed the 30 day return window so now we’re stuck with part of a D80 vacuum and neato has strong feelings against customer satisfaction, so they’re unwilling to replace the missing components.
customer_reviews.author: MomOf2Girls

customer_reviews.title: First I threw my money away,  then I threw their neato away.
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 12 months of use. The sensors that guide it and allow it to turn around failed. Since we owned it for 18 months with 6 months of no use while we were away for the winter, the warranty had expired. You cannot send it back to the factory. They gave me two addresses I could mail it to. Having no idea how much this was going to cost along with mailing costs , I gave up. It isn’t worth spending more on a bad robot. Cost me over $550!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I have to change my review. The robot worked for approximately 3 months. Then, funny things started happening. It wouldn’t charge, it got lost with no changes to the room. Neato sent me a new vacuum. Shortly that one had the same issues. Then they sent me a referbished one. Now, that one won’t even charge. What I spent on this vacuum, I would expect they stood behind their product. What actually happened is they tossed around old vacuums to me until my warranty expired then they told me tough luck. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Ann Vermilyea

customer_reviews.title: it was perfect the first few month then it start acting weird ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it a year ago, it was perfect the first few month then it start acting weird like turn on and off, then battery stopped charging , then it stap working and start asking to clean the brush even after putting the new one, tried to call them spend hours on the phone they never fix the problem , what a waste of time and money
customer_reviews.author: Tetiana

customer_reviews.title: Systematic cleaning done for you
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one after returning one that cleaned randomly. This one does not learn the home, as more expensive ones do, but it does assess the room it is in and clean it systematically and so quite thoroughly. It is very easy to prep the room for it (takes about a minute) and it does well with area rugs that have short fringes. It carefully avoids spaces that will be hard for it to back out of, so misses some smallish areas that need to be cleaned separately. Still, it does the job I wanted it to--be thorough, pick up well, and get under low furniture.
customer_reviews.author: kathy

customer_reviews.title: Mind of it's own.
customer_reviews.text: After having this item for a week. First it gets stuck on my rug. Next the timer is set for 9 am each day, but sometimes around 8-9 pm the device wakes up starts cleaning again. The magnetic strips to tell device, no don't clean here don't pick-up. I thought from the reviews this was a great cleaner. Not sure much after using it. Update... This item biggest piece of crap and customer service is horrible. Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: M_ttC_

customer_reviews.title: Should we replace the D80 or move on.
customer_reviews.text: I am only giving a review at this time.without using our D80.. The first day we got The D80 the Dirt Bin wold not stay in place, it kept popping out of position which caused the D80 to stop. The company told me they have had deflective dirt bins and they would send me a new one. The new one looked exactly like the original and it behaved exactly the same way too. The company now says the problem must be the D80 itself and they would gladly replace it. I would like to hear comments from users of the D80... Has anyone reading this have problems with their D80, as you read my review?
customer_reviews.author: JRW46

customer_reviews.title: Impressive Vacbot!!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second vacbot by Neato,and I must say they continue to impress!! Our first one in an XV 21 that still does a good job. However, this newer version of vacbot has a larger dust bin and a larger filter that improve on capacity and coverage (since it doesn't have to be emptied so often). The battery life is impressive (1hr). The filter is excellent and it is extremely effective, picking up the fine dust particles. We have two cats inside and this little fellow keeps up with the shedding and small bits of cat litter they tend to leave around. I recommend this model to my friends and family as I am definitely a very happy customer!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Celia Evesque

customer_reviews.title: Cheap large quanity canister menu system weak
customer_reviews.text: Good vacation pic up.lots of.pet hair. The size of the container is double many on the market. Do your research in this regard. No WiFi. Menu system is limited old dos based it is not intuitive and clunky. No WiFi interface but you get what you pay for. I was pleasantly surprised by this units ability to traverse a significant threshold in between our kitchen and hallway. So far it has only fallen off step once out of 20 or so uses.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Neato Botvac robot arrived USED
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, item arrived and had already been used. I'm not clear if it works, but assuming if someone used and returned it may not operate correctly. Don't want to figure this out after potential return policy ends with Amazon and/or warranty ends with manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: 1 STAR because a NO STAR rating is not available
customer_reviews.text: The D80 Neato Botvac vacuum worked somewhat properly (except for NOT going to two rooms) for 12 months. During the 13th month all sorts of error messages started to appear and the machine would not work. After repeated calls to Neato's customer service representatives, which were a total waste of time, the last representative stated "we are sorry, but your unit is out of warranty". I now understand why Neato's warranty is only 12 months in duration. My best short description of this product is "mediocre and disposable without the stigma of low price". Neato's customer service was worthless in our experience.
customer_reviews.author: bbtrout

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: 1st one died after 6 weeks. They made me jump thru hoops to get a replacement. Replacement developed 3 separate problems after 2 weeks. Customer service wants me to take videos, try this, take this off, try that... Get a Roomba instead!!!
customer_reviews.author: GJSmitty

customer_reviews.title: I am so annoyed that I trusted this product
customer_reviews.text: Stay away! Mine worked well for exactly one year. Then everything went downhill. It has taken months for them to finally agree to send me a replacement. But at this point I just want my money back, which they won't do. They asked me to service the machine to get it working, and nothing they suggested made any difference in the performance, and I spent hours of frustration on it for nothing! Stay away if you want to avoid that. I am so annoyed that I trusted this product! I should have spent more on a Roomba. At least they have better reviews! Feels like a complete waste of a lot of money!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Miller

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE- you will need to babysit this everywhere
customer_reviews.text: I will say Neato has replied with my complaints, but you need to babysit this unit all the time. We had a perfect older Neato model which is why we bought this one. It often gets "lost" and will clean the same little 2x2 area over and over again until the battery is low and it can't find its charging station... it will get stuck under chairs (in fact it toppled one of our wooden chairs over and broke it), and often gets caught on hair even though this is a pet and allergy thing. Terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: this one seemed the best. NOT DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to drop ~$500 on a vacuum that I have never seen in action. But after reading all the reviews and testimonies about this vacuum and competitors vacuums, this one seemed the best. NOT DISAPPOINTED. Floors have never been cleaner. A bit embarrassed of all the dirt and hair the this Neato D80 vac finds on a regular basis. I had no idea. The dust on the shelves and all horizontal surfaces has diminished to a great extent as well. Have purchased additional filters and side brushes, the extra filters and brushes come with the Neato D85 model. Do your own price comparison before purchase to get the best deal.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Muller

customer_reviews.title: The Terminator of vacuum cleaners.
customer_reviews.text: This lean mean fighting machine eats up the dirt, foliage,and hair from two Border Collies and myself. Without it I would be on my hands and knees cleaning my floors daily. I can't stress how much time this thing has saved me over the past 6 months. It's basically a part of the family now. I've only had to replace a brush because it ate a dog toy I left out and several filters from all the filth it sucked up. If I had to buy it again I would do it in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel

customer_reviews.title: Robot does not do its job
customer_reviews.text: The robot seems to have lost its ability to rope rly clean the home. Doesn’t finish the entire home, does some rooms more than twice, constantly climbs on chair and table kegs, scaring the wood,bnine if the furniture has been moved so by now it should know the rooms. I returned the robot for repair, just received it back. It will not let me set the time, therefore, it will not operate. I told them I want to return the robot for a full refund. Waiting for a response.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charging error code, never even got to use it.
customer_reviews.text: Item never worked from the time I opened the box. After receiving the product, I parked the Neato against the charging base for the night excited to be able to utilize it the next day... checked on it in the morning and had an error 008 battery charging message. Talked to support a few times and tried troubleshooting with no luck. Was supposed to get an advanced exchange but haven’t gotten any type of confirmation on that yet. Disappointed, will be returning and looking at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: do not buy - too fragile
customer_reviews.text: the first one we got worked really well for 2-3 weeks and then broke. I tried a replacement which lasted slightly more than 4 weeks. The company was giving me a hard time about a warranty repair.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the first couple months, then malfunctions would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my wife and it worked great for the first couple of months then it started having small issues of getting stuck, hitting into the wall and losing track of where it had already been and the final straw it started showing an error message to 'turn the switch to on' (the switch was already on) so we would turn it off and then on again and this messages just continues to show and the vacuum no longer charges or vacuums the floors. would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Bodi

customer_reviews.title: Not happy
customer_reviews.text: My original botvac lasted about a month. I sent it back with all the accessories, including an additional filter that came with it. The new botvac came today, but had no additional filter. If I don't hear that a filter is on the way, I think we will send it back and get our money back. After all, the first one gave trouble after one month. My replacement botvac came in February. It has now stopped working. According to Amazon, I can't return it. I suggest that anybody who is thinking of buying one, think again. This was an expensive item, and we can't afford to buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert Kerrigan

customer_reviews.title: JUNK and No customer service that cares..  Quit working after 1 Year.
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY ANYTHING FROM NEATO. My $450 NEATO lasted 1 year. Customer service said your warranty is up. You are out of luck. Neato will do NOTHING for you. Repairs service is about 1/2 the cost of a new one. JUNK. Don't Buy Neato
customer_reviews.author: Snowsleder

customer_reviews.title: On replacement robot #4 in under a year
customer_reviews.text: Would not buy again. We're on our 3rd full robot and our 2nd new battery mailed to us in under 1 year, and it's broke yet again. The batteries fail to charge after a few months, the motor for the brush has locked up, and the last error was the dreaded "push my switch to on" but it's already on and doesn't work, refuses to charge or run. It gets lost daily, battery dies, it constantly stops 1 foot from the charger and dies without recharging. I could do on...we're currently working to get a refund through neato...3 broken robots was enough.
customer_reviews.author: Vandy

customer_reviews.title: I've had two Roomba and two Neato robot vacuums. ...
customer_reviews.text: I've had two Roomba and two Neato robot vacuums. They all break down in about a year regardless of how much you spend on them. I bought my latest Neato on 8-13-2015, about 7 months ago. The problems started about a month ago. I'm getting the dreaded 3000 error message which means it moves about 6 inches away from its base and stops. My house isn't complicated, no stairs, all hardwood, two small dogs, two adults. The side brush fell off after I had it about 2 weeks. They do spoil you, so my advice is to buy the cheapest model and resign yourself to rebuy frequently.
customer_reviews.author: Arlene

customer_reviews.title: No full runs without getting stuck
customer_reviews.text: My first impression was Neato is much smarter than Roomba 880. Neato remembered where is the base station, and went directly to the base. But in the end, vacuum shouldn't look smart, it should work. Roomba behaves more random, but it cleans better. Neato get stuck in very easy situations (see picture). Roomba, even 630, never stuck on flat surface. May issue is that neato only detect obstacles that are on the level of neato's laser system. Roomba uses front bumper to detect obstacles, which is in real life more effective. Neato filter gets clogged really easy. I needed to use usual vacuum to clean its filter. I never had such problems with roomba 630 and 880.
customer_reviews.author: Taras

customer_reviews.title: Works good until 1 year warranty runs out
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 2 of these and when they come up to the one year mark and the warranty is up they stop working. When we call support they tell us it’s the battery. Then we “cycle the battery” which takes about a half hour or so, the vacuum still doesn’t work. Then support will tell us to mail it in, we pay for shipping, and there is no sla on when we get it back. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Azmom13

customer_reviews.title: Evidently I received a dud because I have to come tend to it and restart it way more than any good it does
customer_reviews.text: I have not had this item very long and it has become basically worthless. It can't even change direction when it hits a wall. It wants me to come clear it's path. Evidently I received a dud because I have to come tend to it and restart it way more than any good it does. My mother loves hers but this one is a total malfunction. This product is NFG!!! On my second one and getting no use out of it. It can't even charge itself.
customer_reviews.author: Small Business Owner

customer_reviews.title: Recommend something different
customer_reviews.text: Neto works but build quality and design are lacking. The battery posts broke loose about 18 months in and now it flickers on and off. Tried changing the battery out with a new one but then discovered the broken posts, the battery refuses to fully charge. The machine also claims that the inside switch under the dust bin needs to be switched to the on position when it already is. Also the air out of the back blows straight back... which causes dog hair to blow in to previously cleaned areas... if the exhaust air went up it would get every hair.
customer_reviews.author: tyrrell hearn

customer_reviews.title: Won't last forever, poor motor design.
customer_reviews.text: Well, finally died for good, motor burnt up due to the fact that dog hair can get inside of everything in the vacuum. I've had this almost 4 years now, and other than a few battery replacements it's been great. Unfortunately the design allows for dog hair to get pulled up into the motor area beyond where you can clean. I finally got so much hair impacted up inside the motor that it overheated and burned up, so on to finding a new vacuum. For the $400 I paid for this I wish it would've lasted longer.
customer_reviews.author: j21blackjack

customer_reviews.title: Stupid vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This is the stupidest robotic vacuum, and that's saying something. It constantly gets lost in the home, and then beeps at you like a maniac. It cleans pretty well, when it works, and gets under the furniture. I'm just upset because it takes so much attention. If you don't mind supervising the thing, it will do a good job with the rugs and hard floors, but it can't go 10 minutes without asking for help. The roomba models at least say something like, "move roomba to a new location", but this thing just does the little 'beep - beep', like some demented R2-D2 or something!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Broken software
customer_reviews.text: Had one before which is the best of the best. Second one (this one) not good at all, wont cover all the part of the room, i spoke with customer service in India I guess, no bueno, return it and bought it again, will arrive in a couple of days
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I call him Johnny-5
customer_reviews.text: Second neato vacuum I've owned. This thing picked up noticeably more dust and dirt than my upright that I was using. Love coming home to freshly vacuumed carpets every day! Big improvement over the previous model I used (xv-21) in being able to navigate obstacles like going under beds and around furniture legs. Never tried a roomba, but dollar for dollar this gave me the features I wanted and it doesn't disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: 801Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed with this product at all! I had so much hope for this product and was completely let down. Having 2 dogs in the house, I researched for a vacuum that would be very good with picking up dog hair and fount this one to be reviewed very well for doing so... this product does not even pick up the most simple every day dirt on the floor. As far as being “smarter” than the average vacuum, I have found that to be a huge lie. Would return if I could get my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Emilee Blankenship

customer_reviews.title: And her kids love starting it with the WiFi app from there mom's ...
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my daughter and she is loving it. She says that she never knew that it worked as well as it did and after using it for a few months she would give it a 10 star rating. And her kids love starting it with the WiFi app from there mom's android phone and dumping the dirt bin. Her husband loves showing it off by starting it up for cleaning before company comes over so that they can see it work. Neato cleans her wood floors beautifully. She can't believe how much dirt the Neato Bot finds and picks up everytime it goes out.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Had to buy new battery ($50) after only 9 months
customer_reviews.text: Battery is supposed to last 1-2 years (it says on the Neato). I bought Beato in December 2017 and it is now September 2018 and the battery is out. Warranty is only 6 months so Customer support said that I have to buy a new battery for $50. Terrible. I would not buy again. It was pretty good while it lasted (for 9 months) but not worth it given it only lasted 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: Aimee

customer_reviews.title: Died after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: These units work great until they stop working which for me was 4 months. After many messages back and forth with customer service they agreed to let me send it back for repair but stated that if they found any dirt or pet hair in the unit they would not warranty it. It's a vacuum made for pets so there might be a tiny bit of dirt or pet hair that doesn't come out with a good cleaning but it was clear they would use that as an excuse to not warranty the unit. I would lose money on shipping if I sent it in and it didn't get fixed so I didn't bother.
customer_reviews.author: Red09Low

customer_reviews.title: Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely frustrated... how can a 500$ vacuum not come with with compatibility to connect to your smart phone. I have been trying to program on the vacuum and i hate it. I’m not patient enough to sit and program everyday. Extremely disappointed the it gets stuck on my shag rug... Caution to new robot vacuum owners. 😩 I started using the stripes to keep it off my carpet seems to do okay. Overall, not very happy with the product so I have decided to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Erica G.

customer_reviews.title: bought this in nov of 2016 we r now on ...
customer_reviews.text: bought this in nov of 2016 we r now on second unit witch just died after only 4 months. neato replaced it the first time because it was still under their 1 year waranty now i am having to deal with squaretrade what a joke totally regret this purchase and the squaretrade purchase do not buy this product. we had a cheaper model of neato before this one exact same problem.
customer_reviews.author: bad

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware. Low quality. No warranty.
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for about a month. And then it died. Battery completely shot. I contacted Neato support, who told me that since Amazon is not an authorized reseller it was not under warranty and they would not do anything about it. They suggested I find a local vacuum repair shop. So you can pay $500 for a robot that breaks in less than a month and have no warranty for it. Shady. Look elsewhere. The product is low quality and the manufacturer will not stand behind it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: it does a very good job. However
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it does a very good job. However, the customer support from NEATO is terrible. Takes forever to get approval for replacing a defective battery then even longer for approval to exchange the defective unit. Have two of them and other one works flawlessly. Too bad a good product doesn't have acceptable customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: It's ok...
customer_reviews.text: It cleans really well. It is very stupid though, it has no idea where it's base is and spends almost 30 minutes looking for its base before it dies completely and we have to carry it to its base. If you have a shag rug, buy extra magnetic boundary strips. It has broken its brush from tangling with the rug. Other than that, it works well. I still would rather have gotten something else but too late now. We will try moving the base to another room.
customer_reviews.author: Mona

customer_reviews.title: Switched from Roomba.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! I've had mixed and worsening experiences with roomba. The last one was DOA and wasn't even functional out of the box. A couple of folks I know recommended this. It's a great device. It is much smarter about how it vacuums so it gets done much faster and can cover a much larger area on the available battery charge. It has much better suction than any of the roombas as I've owned, but is a bit louder too. Durability is an area where the roombas always fell down. I've only had this for a month or two so it's a bit early to tell on that score. So far I'm pretty impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick C. Neil

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this vacuum
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum is not good. I'm so disappointed. It gets stuck everywhere and can't find its way back to the base. I wanted something that would run when I wasn't home, and all it does is get stuck and then beep incessantly until someone comes to free it. It's very frustrating. I wish I could get my money back. Think carefully before you spend almost $500 for this. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Denise Schuetter

customer_reviews.title: This thing is AMAZING. With four dogs
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AMAZING. With four dogs, you can imagine the constant cleanup. This is actually quieter than I had anticipated. It's very intuitive and just WORKS. Our floors are much happier now! I thought it would drive the dogs nuts but other than it's initial sweep, they don't even notice it. I bought this at the recommendation of America's Test Kitchen and it did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: S. Root

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Machine
customer_reviews.text: I had a roomba for over 3 years which ran perfectly. Decided to buy a neato, turn into a horrible decision as it doesn't clean as well and died after 10 months. This machine's always making noises about something, you are better off buying a crappy roomba than this piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: I have two kids and three indoor dogs, and boy, can this thing clean! I have had several robotic vacuums, and this one removed the most dirt, dog hair, etc from my wood and tile floors. I really think the non-random pattern it follows does make a huge difference in cleaning. Not as important, but the sound of it somewhat soothing and it is an upscale looking vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Great for rooms with little clutter.
customer_reviews.text: We have three part time rental properties that we use this vacuum in. The floors are a combination of wood, tile and carpet. The good: It does pick up dirt and hair pretty good. It is very easy to use. The bad, It gets stuck on small items, like small rugs. It also wedges itself under a couple pieces of the furniture and gets stuck. Battery lasts about an hour. I find that it works best when I clear the floor of large items, like shoes, toys, small rugs and so on and then put it room in to clean. I then take it to next room to do same thing. I recognize that this unit is the basic model.
customer_reviews.author: Tania Baaske

customer_reviews.title: I wish did took a charge and work correctly .
customer_reviews.text: I like the robotics in the idea of having a vacuum to run at night , but I found that this vacuum that I had did not and would not take a charge so I sent it back for a refund . I so much wanted it to work it would've made my life a great deal easier .
customer_reviews.author: seaworthy

customer_reviews.title: Won’t by botvac again
customer_reviews.text: Update from 5 stars to 3 stars. I have 4 neatos. Owned 6 over the years. The first models the signature pros were bullet proof and dependable. The only ones I’ve had issues with are the Botvacs. Neatos customer service used to be fabulous but lately they miss the mark. Be aware that any issue you must mail into a third party repair. Example the last botvac missed warranty by 1 month. I had to mail it for $14 plus pay $200 plus change for a new motherboard and postage back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wish we hadn't!  Had nothing but trouble.
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd Neato Botvac. Obviously we love it! We find our selves talking to "her". We named our first Daisy and this one is D2. My house cleaner tries to out do her on the vacuum stripes but can't. She laughs and says she can't believe she's talking to a robot. This is an extravagance and I wondered if we'd replace her when she died, and obviously we did.
customer_reviews.author: D. J. Storie

customer_reviews.title: Will be buying another iroomba waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Neaton botvac to upgrade my old iroomba. The Botvac proceeded to move my furniture around and had technical issues right out of the box. It's screen display kept asking to clear it's path.. There was never anything in front of it. Contacted company who sent out a replacement which took a long time. Had new one 1 day...did the same thing :(. Returned to Amazon. Will be buying another iroomba waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Unacceptably Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: The first Neato I purchased lasted 14 months (mainboard failure). This unit lasted 16 months (Lidar failure). The quality is unacceptable and I will not buy the brand again.
customer_reviews.author: D. Com

customer_reviews.title: Good at first, didn’t last.
customer_reviews.text: This was a pretty helpful tool at first. It ran a few times a week, easy to clean bin, mapped pretty well. It did a great job for surface cleaning. Then one day it said to clean the brush, I did and it has never worked again. Constantly says to switch on battery which is already on. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: DesertJae

customer_reviews.title: Value for the cost is not in the Neato
customer_reviews.text: The Neato vacuum worked great for about a year and a half. After that time, it quit working and shows error messages which can't be resolved. I bought a new battery and new filters only to have the message error to continue. For the extra cost of Neato and short useful life, you would be better off to purchase a different brand robot vacuum which costs less. The value for the cost is not the Neato robot vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the frustration
customer_reviews.text: Would give a zero star review if I could, from the day we got this vacuum it's been a constant source of anger. Lid button sensor is very poorly designed, and most of the time will not actually register the lid as being closed. When it isn't incorrectly complaining about the lid being opened it's throwing errors asking to turn the power switch on, which it ALWAYS is. Goes through batteries in months, and re-calibrating is a huge hassle. Would not recommend this model, even if you're getting a good deal due to its age.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Pittman

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE this!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the fact that this was a bit expensive. I bought a refurbished one. I’m sad that I didn’t make this purchase much earlier. We have several pets and live on a farm. The carpets have to be vacuumed every single day. Because of an illness I’m not able to vacuum as much as I should, but this little thing takes care of that!! I still do a thorough cleaning once a week, but I no longer have to do it daily. No worries about getting over thresholds or marking furniture either. My best buy to date!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Adams

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, 3 broken in 1 year.
customer_reviews.text: The D80 does a great job cleaning when it's operational. Unfortunately, this model has a pension for dying randomly. In the past year I've have 3 separate units stop working (the original one I purchased plus 2 replacement units). There seems to be a systemic issue of failure after 4ish months of regular use. With a warranty of only 1 year and a poor lifespan, I would recommend buyers avoid this particular Neato model.
customer_reviews.author: Ryne Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Hope you never have to use the warranty
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine until needed a warranty issue. Neato has had my botvac for 3+ weeks without any indication of a replacement. I don't even have a robot that I can replace parts myself - I sent in the entire robot per their request and have no idea when I'll have a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: BVH

customer_reviews.title: READ THE OTHER ONE STAR REVIEWS!!
customer_reviews.text: READ ALL THE OTHER ONE STAR REVIEWS!!! They are all correct. This thing cleans like a beast.....for a few months at most. I had 3 BRAND NEW replacements in a year thru Neato and all 3 broke. I am now using the Asurion warranty and I am about to call in for the 3rd time in 3 months for a repair. At this point I just want my money back.
customer_reviews.author: P. O'B

customer_reviews.title: Sudden death + zero customer service response = unhappy customer
customer_reviews.text: Loved it for 5 months...then it died. Some bizarre error message telling me to open the dirt bin and flip a switch to "on," except the switch already is in that position. It will no longer vacuum either on schedule or on demand -- yes, that's right, it no longer works at all. Does absolutely nothing except sit there and beep at me angrily every time I try to fix it. Neato is not responding to customer support emails, and their online chat support is never available. This is too much money to spend on a vacuum if it's going to spontaneously break and then customer service is going to be completely MIA.
customer_reviews.author: TwoTexans

customer_reviews.title: An excellent robot vacuum
customer_reviews.text: We have had several vacs in the last few years trying to find something to keep up with dogs and country living dust and grand kids. I sure this vac will improve but this unit does pretty well. Our house is a mix of hard floors and area rugs one wit 1/2 inch pile. This machine cleans well and rarely hangs up. Had Roomba several years ago but pet hair would work its way into cleaning gear set and ruin assembly. After a month it still cleans whole 1400 square foot house quietly with few issues. dogs aren't even bothered by it now, great piece of kit.
customer_reviews.author: J&N O

customer_reviews.title: Expected More
customer_reviews.text: This bot does a good job getting up the dog hair and dirt. I have to empty the bin everyday which is not ideal and it often times gets stuck on items and sometimes has a hard time going back to the base once it's done cleaning. With that being said, I think I would still purchase this again. Having a clean floor without too much effort is really nice and helps to keep my house really clean.
customer_reviews.author: Misseyaz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Hi, The D80 works great. I'm familiar with Neato and it turns out they just made a significant progress from previous model. The robot is very quick and quiet. It picks A LOT Of dust. The side brush seems subtle, but it had a great effect. The manuverring capabilities improved. Finally, the most important feature the house looks great after a cleaning cycle both carpets and tiles.
customer_reviews.author: edy

customer_reviews.title: Not charging or working within three months of purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I loved it but it broke three months after purchase. Won't charge or turn on and no idea why! For this money this us appalling!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah M.

customer_reviews.title: It stopped taking a charge after 18 months of once-a-week use.
customer_reviews.text: It quit taking a charge! I bought it new, used it about once a week, and initially this robot vacuum did a good job of cleaning the hardwood floor, including dog hair after our son's dogs were in the house. When I added low-pile area rugs, it did a good job on those, too. However, after just one year of use, the screen readout started instructing me to turn the switch on, even though it was still turned on. I had to flip the switch off and back on, sometimes several times before it would stay on. Then within another 6 months it quit taking a charge at all. Expensive piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: Abe Mouracade

customer_reviews.title: dud
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Neato before and it was wonderful and it ran almost everyday and lasted probably 3 or 4 years. This one however is horrible. I paid way more and it does not work. It cannot find its charging base. Gets stuck in places and I am constantly having to go find it. It has finally quit working completely. I have a friend that I talked into one and she is having the exact same problems. I am hoping that they will take it back. I would never buy one again if this is what the new ones are like.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great at first, but it is garbage after 1 year
customer_reviews.text: Updating a prior review where I gave this robot 5 stars. I should have waited a few months. My comments reflect many similar delayed reviews. This robot works great, until the warranty expires. It's almost like clockwork. You will need to replace the battery, fix laser issues, constantly clear its path, etc. This piece of junk is the definition of planned obsolescence. I'd recommend you place greater weight on reviews where the robot has been owned for more than 6-12 months, or save yourself the grief and buy a different product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Dick

customer_reviews.title: Batteries only last 4-5 months!!!
customer_reviews.text: I am very sad to report that we learned we had to buy a new battery every 4-5 months - and we didn't even use it that much. I really like the IDEA of this kind of vacuum but we sure can't afford to buy a new battery that often. And, I have learned, since we purchased this product, that there are other way more powerful brands/models. I was new with ordering online and did not read the reviews or, I would not have purchased it to begin with. It was great for picking up dust and dog hair!
customer_reviews.author: Guruatma K.

customer_reviews.title: Wow I don't know why I didn't buy this when it came out.
customer_reviews.text: Wow works like a champ! First day using it. It had to charge twice and I emtied the container twice. Picked up the dust bunnies all over the house. I don't have carpets just wood and tyle, left my house to do some errands came back and immediately noticed the difference. I might by another one its that good. Now instead of two hours of sweeping i just mop when I need to. What a time saver.
customer_reviews.author: Balderdash72

product_meta.title: Neato Botvac D80 Robot Vacuum for Pets and Allergies
product_meta.description: Size:D80Smart, powerful, high-performance Robot vacuum. Great for homes with pets. While you do other things, Neato BotVac vacuums dirt, crumbs, dust bunnies, and pet hair from all floor types and every corner of your home. D-shape with corner clever - exclusive d-shape with corner clever technology destroys dirt where it hides and keeps corners clean. Extra large bag less dirtying and Jumbo high performance filter capture particles as small as 0.3 microns, like mold and pet dander. Perfect for all floor types and pet hair pick-up.
feature_bullets: Patented Neato technology - the laser smart mapping and navigation system scans and maps the room, plans, and methodically cleans instead of bumping around.
D-Shape design with CornerClever technology gets close to walls and into corners offering maximum hair pickup. Picks up more pet hair than other bots;Charger Voltage : 110V, 220V

SpinFlow Power Clean technology combines potent suction and precision brushes to leave floors immaculately clean. Includes easy-to-swap combo & blade brushes offering maximum cleaning. Precise edge cleaning side brush makes sure not a speck of dust is left behind.

Auto-charge & resume lets your robot clean room to room - when it needs more power, it automatically returns to charge, then returns to where it left off & finishes the job. It tackles up to 3000 square feet of floor space per cleaning cycle with ease and automatically recharges
For issues, please refer to the user manual or contact Neato support at 1-877-296-3286. Ensure that both the filter and dirt bin are clean and properly inserted
LaserSmart mapping and navigation system scans and maps the room, plans, and methodically cleans—instead of bumping around.
D-Shape design with CornerClever technology gets close to walls and into corners. Maximum hair pickup. Picks up more pet hair than other bots.
SpinFlow Power Clean combines potent suction and precision brushes to leave floors immaculately clean. Includes both combo brush, spiral blade brush, and side brush.
Auto-Charge & Resume lets your robot clean room to room; when it needs more power, it automatically returns to charge, then returns to where it left off & finishes the job.
Kindly refer the user manual given below for product information.
No international Shipping. Be sure the charging base has 3’ of clearance of both sides. This facilitates the robot returning to base without issues.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars3,156 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
